title.narrative: Early detection of COVID-19 in vulnerable populations of the Diocese of Verapaz, Guatemala

description.narrative:
Dr. Conchita Reyes (medical doctor), CAFOD Guatemalan church partner director, is asking for further support due to a request that came from the municipality of Cobán from the Emergency Operations Center (COE in Spanish), where they are asking for support to provide COVID-19 tests to health services, given the government regulations and that they no longer have enough supplies. We and they know that it is the obligation of the Ministry of Health to provide these tests, but since the decisions are made at the central level (national, at the capital city), when they arrive to this region (Cobán, capital of Alta Verapaz), they will not be sure of how many cases there are and perhaps people may complicate their health status because they do not have an accurate diagnosis. In general, there is no access to testing when you leave the capital in Guatemala. And if there is, it’s with great delay.
The project will cover the purchase of 650 COVID-19 tests (2 different types) and their delivery.
